translation.text: Gauree, Third Mehl:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

translation.text: Selfless service is the support of the breath of life of the Gurmukh.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

author.author: Guru Amar Das
author.description:
Guru Amar Das [1479 - 1574] was the third Guru of the Sikhs, born at Basarke in Amritsar. His father, Tej Bhan and mother Bakht Kaur were orthodox Hindus. He became the oldest Sikh Guru.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

text: ਹਰਿ ਜੀਉ ਰਾਖਹੁ ਹਿਰਦੈ ਉਰ ਧਾਰਾ ॥

translation.text: Keep the Dear Lord enshrined in your heart.

transliteration.text: har jīu rākhah hiradai ur dhārā .

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

translation.text: The Gurmukh is honored in the Court of the True Lord. ||1||

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

translation.text: O Pandit, O religious scholar, read about the Lord, and renounce your corrupt ways.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

translation.text: The Gurmukh crosses over the terrifying world-ocean. ||1||Pause||

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. translation.text: The Gurmukh eradicates egotism from within.

translation.text: No filth sticks to the Gurmukh.

translation.text: The Naam, the Name of the Lord, comes to dwell within the mind of the Gurmukh. ||2||

translation.text: Through karma and Dharma, good actions and righteous faith, the Gurmukh becomes true.

translation.text: The Gurmukh burns away egotism and duality.

translation.text: The Gurmukh is attuned to the Naam, and is at peace. ||3||

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. translation.text: Instruct your own mind, and understand Him.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. translation.text: You may preach to other people, but no one will listen.

translation.text: The self-willed manmukhs are such clever hypocrites.

text: ਜੋ ਕਿਛੁ ਕਮਾਵੈ ਸੁ ਥਾਇ ਨ ਪਾਈ ॥

translation.text: No matter what they do, it is not acceptable.

transliteration.text: jō kish kamāvai s thāi n pāī .

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

translation.text: They come and go in reincarnation, and find no place of rest. ||5||

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. translation.text: The manmukhs perform their rituals, but they are totally selfish and conceited.

text: ਬਗ ਜਿਉ ਲਾਇ ਬਹੈ ਨਿਤ ਧਿਆਨਾ ॥

translation.text: They sit there, like storks, pretending to meditate.

transliteration.text: bag jiu lāi bahai nit dhiānā .

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

translation.text: Caught by the Messenger of Death, they shall regret and repent in the end. ||6||

text: ਬਿਨੁ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸੇਵੇ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਨ ਹੋਈ ॥

translation.text: Without serving the True Guru, liberation is not obtained.

transliteration.text: bin satigur sēvē mukat n hōī .

translation.text: The Guru is the Great Giver, throughout the four ages. ||7||
